title: Gum, Disease
synopsis: The rapport between Branford Marsalis and Space Ghost makes it lookas though the then-band leader of "The Tonight Show" might be switching talk shows. Next, a child star from the same television era as Space Ghost, Danny Bonaduce, talks about his days with the Partridge family and his deep-seated hatred for Osmonds.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Inviso in... (invisos out) Inviso out... (invisos in) Inviso in... There, seems okay now.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What ruckus? (Moltar sneezes again, studio shakes)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (aside) That was odd. (aloud) Greetings! I am Space Ghost. (smiles, light glints off his teeth) My guests tonight are recording artist and "Tonight Show" band leader Branford Marsalis, and former "Partridge Family" member Danny Bona-, Bon-, Bonaduckie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, that... (final drum beat) was less than satisfactory. Explain yourself.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I.. don't know. Don't look at me!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, don't. (Zorak & Space Ghost stare at each other; Zorak blinks)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okey-dokey! My first guest, unlike Zorak, is a talented musician. Please welcome Branford Marsalis. (monitor lowers, but bounces repeatedly) Moltar! Bad director!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have to use freeze ray. (Fires freeze ray at monitor, it finally stops bouncing) Okay now. No more slip-ups. Remember, this is a professional talk show. (someone drops a microphone, feedback ensues; Moltar coughs in background) (pause) Branford!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey right back at you, Branford. So how goes the "Tonight Show"?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very much, Mr. Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: No, but I'll have some shortly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, do you enjoy being the "Tonight Show" band leader?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is it fun? Do you enjoy working with Jay Leno?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: In a way, you're like Ricky Ricardo, except without all that other stuff.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what evil crime have you committed against Jay Leno to become his band leader?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: I don't, I don't know. I would, I... I really don't think I've done anything wrong.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sound of gavel falling) Guilty! (crowd murmuring in background) So, what does Jay Leno do to help defend the universe?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: He doesn't do anything to help the universe. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This concerns me. So, what is he like, then?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: He has all the money, all the babes, all the cars. He's the host. He's just like you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hardly! I keep the universe safe; he doesn't! And, I have more trophies. (smiles, light glints off his teeth again)

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'll tell his you said that, and I'll tell his wife too. (glare from Space Ghost's teeth starts overloading the cameras)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! Shut your big mouth!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: (voiceover) We now join Space Ghost Coast to Coast, already in progress.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... something crawling on the table... (looks up) Who was that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Alrighty. (normal voice) So, Branford, you have a new album! Tell us about it!

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it's a, it's a really nice album, it's a very dramatic departure from what I usually do. It's more like a, a pop album.

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: There's a lot of strange mixes on there...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Speaking of strange mixes, you know what I had for breakfast this morning?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A sausage and mayonnaise soup, with a cream of corn omelet. (groans and grumbling voices in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Some milk I left out in the sun for a week...

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Oh, come on, don't do that, man!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I just hurled in my helmet!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I... think it's time to take a break (sound of a container being emptied) Moltar! Not in the control room!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (playing "Sonic the Hedgehog" on monitor; exits game) Okay, we're back with Branford the Branford.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Branford, I wonder, does Doc Severinson ever show up and offer useless advice and mess with your horn section?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Well, Doc gave me some really good advice right before, uh, the show started...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That Doc! You've gotta love him.

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, he's, he's, he's hype, he's dope, he's, he's crazy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares at Zorak) So, Branford, do you have musical knowledge to share with Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Well, not the kind of knowledge you're referring to, but... (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Oh, sorry, were you... nothing, were you saying something, Mr. Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He was asking you, where's Zorak's gum? For me! Mine! My gum! Mine, not yours!

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, never eat anything larger than your head. (to Space Ghost) How's that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Would you care to join us for dinner after the show, Branford?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Absolutely, what do we have, rabbit?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I will eat your liver, with some fava beans and a fine Chianti. (sup sup sup sup sup) Oh, and some gum.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, right, Zorak. You and what army?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ehhh, the Kiss Army. (Army voices: "Yeaaahhh! Destroy Rock City!")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Er, right, right. (pause) Branford, I mean, Branford, before you go, will you scat?

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's gonna cost you, bro, you know I won two Grammies.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (at desk with laser rifle) Make with the scatting (fires rifle)

transcript.speaker: Branford Marsalis
transcript.dialogue: A one, a two, a one two three... (scats for 4 bars) (to Space Ghost) Go!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (tries to scat for a couple bars) Take it, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scats again; Moltar sneezes, and Branford's image is replaced by Danny Bonaduce's)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost... (Space Ghost keeps scatting) Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops) Hey, that's not Branford! It's that Partridge kid!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what have you been up to lately?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Space Ghost. Well, I, I've been very busy, but before I even say what I've been doing, let me just say I have been on with some of the biggest talk show hosts in the world...

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: ... and this is an honor for me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, you have been in some trouble, haven't you, young man? In fact, you're very lucky to even be on my show. Don't you think you should thank me?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: Ha ha ha ha ha... Very funny...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's more like it. So, Danny boy, what super-power helped you battle the child star syndrome?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: I used the power of invisibility.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Would you use this super-power to help other child star victims?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: No, because I have met other child star victims, and I've got to say that it's my opinion that they pretty much are getting what they deserve.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Danny, do you mind my asking how much you made from all those years as a Partridge?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: I've got about eighty bucks and a lunchbox.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's it? That show made truckloads of cash! Boy, did you get rooked!

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: Shirley Jones, David Cassidy, that's where all the money went.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's pathetic how they treat talent in Hollywood. Right, uh, talent, personality, and a quarter will get you a cup of coffee.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: [No talent and no personality will get you a talk show]

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: [Uhhhh...] Danny, what was your favorite thing about the seventies?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in "punk" outfit) Whip it, whip it good!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: [Uhhhh...] Danny, what was your favorite Partridge Family song?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: I actually have a couple. "Echo Valley 2-6809" was one of my favorites. By the way, if you call that, you actually get an old lady in Arizona, it's very cool.

transcript.speaker: Old Lady
transcript.dialogue: (phone rings, she answers) Hello? Hello? Hello!

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: "I Woke Up In Love This Morning" (starts singing song)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I understand you're in radio now. Plug your station!

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: I work at -- (screen zaps, replaced by little girl playing a guitar & singing)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, um, sorry. I was sitting on the remote.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) So, we lost Danny. That's okay. (screen zaps back)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What did you want to become when you were a kid?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: When I was a, a kid, I really only wanted two things. I wanted to be a policeman...

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: ... and, uh, to punch out Donny Osmond, or really any member of the Osmond family.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: When I was a larvae, I wanted to be the all-powerful ruler of the universe! (crown appears on his head)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Me too! (crown appears on his head also)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you know what gum is?

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever met Donny Osmond, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'd... (crown appears on his head) I'd rather not talk about it. (crown disappears)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Danny, you sound rather hoarse. Perhaps you've got The Sick of Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe I should take a look. Say "Ahhhhh!"

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: AaaaaaAAAAAAHHHHHH!!!!! (glass breaks all over the studio, alarms go off)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! (gets pulled out of his seat, flies across room) Wheeeee!!

transcript.speaker: Danny Bonaduce
transcript.dialogue: You know, I, sort of after this, Leno sucks.
